nodes.name: Sticky Note2

nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
### Project Benefit üéßüåü

The goal of this awesome project is to turn those "CATEGORY_PROMOTIONS" emails into a super cool audio podcast! üéôÔ∏è This way, users can kick back and enjoy the promotional content without having to squint at their screens. By listening instead of reading, users can soak in the info in a fun and easy way.

This project rocks a workflow using n8n to automate tasks like a boss. Each node in the workflow plays its part in a smooth operation. Check out the main players:

1. **Gmail trigger1 Node**: Kicks off the action every minute for those "CATEGORY_PROMOTIONS" emails.
   
2. **Get message content1 Node**: Grabs the email content for some magic.
      
3. **Summarization Chain3 Node**: Whips up some sweet summaries using fancy chunking methods.
   
4. **Delete the unnecessary items Node**: Clears out the clutter from the email content.
   
5. **Text to Free TTS Node**: Turns the summary into speech using Free TTS magic.
   
6. **Convert from base64 to File Node**: Changes the audio into a file format.
   
7. **Merge Text with Audio Node**: Mixes the text and audio together for a cool combo.
   
8. **Aggregate in same cell Node**: Puts all the data together for more awesomeness.
   
10. **Send Message to Telegram Node**: Sends the final audio message with a caption to a special Telegram chat ID.

This workflow is like a well-oiled machine, with each step flowing seamlessly into the next. By automating these tasks, this project aims to make communication a breeze and bring joy to all involved! üåà‚ú®üöÄ

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
### This API allows automatic text-to-speech generation.
You can utilize this API by sending a POST request to the specified link and including JSON data containing the text you want to convert to speech, along with selecting your preferred voice.

When using this API, make sure to include the `Content-Type` header with the value `application/json` to ensure proper interpretation of the request data.

The API offers a user-friendly interface where you can simply submit the desired text and choose the appropriate voice, then receive an audio file containing the generated speech.

Using this API can be beneficial for quickly generating audio clips for texts in an efficient manner.

You can access this API at [{{ $env.API_BASE_URL }}]({{ $env.API_BASE_URL }} or keep it as is without changing anything as provided on [{{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

values.prompt:
Craft a concise newsletter using the given content. Include emojis, avoid starting with the subject word, summarize linked articles briefly, and ensure it's under 247 characters for easy TTS readability, and after that chick if it's very short to pass it:



"{text}"

Craft a concise newsletter using the given content. Include emojis, avoid starting with the subject word, summarize linked articles briefly, and ensure it's under 247 characters for easy TTS readability, and after that chick if it's very short to pass it:


"{text}"

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Stickynote Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Stickynote Workflow. This workflow integrates 12 different services: convertToFile, stickyNote, httpRequest, telegram, code. It contains 19 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 19
- **Node Types**: 12
- **Error Handling**: ‚úÖ Implemented
- **Security**: ‚úÖ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ‚úÖ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Sticky Note2**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Get message content1**: gmail
- **OpenAI Chat Model3**: lmChatOpenAi
- **Delete the unnecessary items**: code
- **Aggregate in same cell**: aggregate
- **Gmail trigger**: gmailTrigger
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **Convert from base64 to File**: convertToFile
- **Merge Text with Audio**: merge
- ... and 9 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
